page.title: 02 ST. MARY'S CHURCH
page.content: St. Mary's is a very old church part of which probably dates back to Saxon times. Some of the grave stones are so old that they have sunk halfway into the ground. The lych-gate is where people put the coffins down and had a rest. Inside the church the seats are wooden and there are a lot of stained glass windows. There is a war memorial outside. To the left of the church is the rectory where the rector, Rev. Johnston-Hubbold lives. The church has a weather cock on the spire which can be seen from many points within our grid.
